name: Weapon Potency (+1)
desc:
Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.

You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
craftRequirement: You are an expert in Crafting.

name: Returning
desc: When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

hints.desc: When you make a thrown Strike with this weapon, it flies back to your hand after the Strike is complete. If your hands are full when the weapon returns, it falls to the ground in your space.

name: Striking
desc:
A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.

name: Ghost Touch
desc: The weapon can harm creatures without physical form. A ghost touch weapon is particularly effective against incorporeal creatures, which almost always have a specific weakness to ghost touch weapons. Incorporeal creatures can touch, hold, and wield ghost touch weapons (unlike most physical objects).

hints.desc: The weapon can harm creatures without physical form.

name: Disrupting
desc: A disrupting weapon pulses with positive energy, dealing an extra 1d6 positive damage to undead. On a critical hit, the undead is also enfeebled 1 until the end of your next turn.
criticalHint: On a critical hit on an undead, the undead is enfeebled 1 until the end of your next turn.

name: Shifting
desc: With a moment of manipulation, you can shift this weapon into a different weapon with a similar form.

activities.desc: The weapon takes the shape of another melee weapon that requires the same number of hands to wield. The weapon's runes and any precious material it's made of apply to the weapon's new shape. Any property runes that can't apply to the new form are suppressed until the item takes a shape to which they can apply.
activities.inputRequired: The transformation is not automated. You must add the desired weapon and apply all applicable runes manually.
activities.name: Shifting Rune

name: Wounding
desc: Weapons with wounding runes are said to thirst for blood. When you hit a creature with a wounding weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 persistent bleed damage. On a critical hit, it instead deals 1d12 persistent bleed damage.
criticalHint: The weapon deals |dice=1d12 Persistent Bleed| 1d12 persistent bleed damage instead of 1d6.
usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon

name: Corrosive
desc: Acid sizzles across the surface of the weapon. When you hit with the weapon, add 1d6 acid damage to the damage dealt. In addition, on a critical hit, the target's armor (if any) takes 3d6 acid damage (before applying Hardness); if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.
criticalHint: The target's armor takes |dice=3d6 Acid| 3d6 acid damage before applying Hardness; if the target has a shield raised, the shield takes this damage instead.

name: Flaming
desc: This weapon is empowered by flickering flame. The weapon deals an additional 1d6 fire damage on a successful Strike, plus 1d10 persistent fire damage on a critical hit.
criticalHint: The weapon deals |dice=1d19 Persistent Fire| 1d10 persistent fire damage.

name: Frost
desc: This weapon is empowered with freezing ice. It deals an additional 1d6 cold damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target is also slowed 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.
criticalHint: The target is slowed 1 until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a DC 24 Fortitude save.

name: Shock
desc: Electric arcs crisscross this weapon, dealing an extra 1d6 electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, electricity arcs out to deal an equal amount of electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the target.
criticalHint: Electricity arcs out to deal |dice=1d6 Electricity| 1d6 electricity damage to up to two other creatures of your choice within 10 feet of the weapon target.

name: Thundering
desc: This weapon lets out a peal of thunder when it hits, dealing an extra 1d6 sonic damage on a successful Strike. On a critical hit, the target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).
criticalHint: The target has to succeed at a DC 24 Fortitude save or be deafened for 1 minute (or 1 hour on a critical failure).

name: Grievous
desc: When your attack roll with this weapon is a critical hit and gains the critical specialization effect, you gain an additional benefit depending on the weapon group.
criticalHint: When your attack roll with this weapon is a critical hit and gains the critical specialization effect, you gain the following benefit depending on the weapon group:

data.name: Axe
data.value: You can damage a third creature, with the same restrictions.

data.name: Bow
data.value: The Athletics check to pull the missile free is DC 20.

data.name: Brawling
data.value: The target takes a -4 circumstance penalty to its save.

data.name: Club
data.value: You can knock the target up to 15 feet away.

data.name: Dart
data.value: The base persistent bleed damage increases to 2d6.

data.name: Flail
data.value: You move the target 5 feet. You can't move it away from you, but you can move it in another direction of your choice.

data.name: Hammer
data.value: You can also knock the target 5 feet away from you.

data.name: Knife
data.value: The target takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speed while it has the persistent bleed damage.

data.name: Pick
data.value: The extra damage from the critical specialization effect increases to 4 per weapon damage die.

data.name: Polearm
data.value: You can move the target up to 10 feet.

data.name: Shield
data.value: You can knock the target up to 10 feet away.

data.name: Sling
data.value: The target also takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed for 1 round if it fails the save.

data.name: Spear
data.value: The clumsy condition lasts for 2 rounds.

data.name: Sword
data.value: The target is flat-footed until the end of your next turn.

name: Weapon Potency (+2)
desc:
Magical enhancements make this weapon strike true. Attack rolls with this weapon gain a +1 item bonus, and the weapon can be etched with one property rune.

You can upgrade the weapon potency rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
subTypeDesc: The item bonus to attack rolls is +2, and the weapon can be etched with two property runes.
craftRequirement: You are a master in Crafting.

name: Anarchic
desc:
An anarchic rune is jagged and asymmetrical, channeling chaotic energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 chaotic damage against lawful targets. If you are lawful, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

When you critically succeed at a Strike with this weapon against a lawful creature, roll 1d6. On a 1 or 2, you deal double minimum damage; on a 3 or 4, double your damage normally; on a 5 or 6, you deal double maximum damage.
criticalHint: On a critical hit against a lawful creature, roll |dice=1d6| 1d6. On a 1 or 2, you deal double minimum damage; on a 3 or 4, double your damage normally; on a 5 or 6, you deal double maximum damage.
usage: etched onto a weapon without an axiomatic rune

name: Axiomatic
desc:
Complex and symmetrical, an axiomatic rune imbues a weapon with lawful energy. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 lawful damage against chaotic targets. If you are chaotic, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.

When you critically succeed at an attack roll with this weapon against a chaotic creature, instead of rolling, count each weapon damage die as average damage rounded up (3 for d4, 4 for d6, 5 for d8, 6 for d10, 7 for d12).
criticalHint: On a critical hit against a chaotic creature, instead of rolling, count each weapon damage die as average damage rounded up (3 for d4, 4 for d6, 5 for d8, 6 for d10, 7 for d12).
usage: etched onto a weapon without an anarchic rune

name: Holy
desc: Holy weapons command powerful celestial energy. A weapon with this rune deals an extra 1d6 good damage against evil targets. If you are evil, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.
usage: etched onto a weapon without an unholy rune

activities.desc: You regain HP equal to double the evil creature's level. This is a good, positive, healing effect.
activities.inputRequired: You regain HP equal to double the evil creature's level.
activities.name: Holy Rune
activities.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll against an evil creature with the weapon

name: Unholy
desc: An unholy rune instills fiendish power into the etched weapon. A weapon with this rune deals an additional 1d6 evil damage when it hits a good target. If you are good, you are enfeebled 2 while carrying or wielding this weapon.
usage: etched onto a weapon without a holy rune

activities.desc: The target takes persistent bleed damage equal to 1d8 per weapon damage die of the etched weapon.
activities.name: Unholy Rune
activities.trigger: You critically succeed at an attack roll against a good creature with the weapon

name: Striking (Greater)
desc:
A striking rune stores destructive magic in the weapon, increasing the weapon damage dice it deals to two instead of one. For instance, a +1 striking dagger would deal 2d4 damage instead of 1d4 damage.

You can upgrade the striking rune already etched on a weapon to a stronger version, increasing the values of the existing rune to those of the new rune. You must have the formula of the stronger rune to do so, and the Price of the upgrade is the difference between the two runes' Prices.
subTypeDesc: The weapon deals three weapon damage dice.

name: Dancing
desc: A dancing weapon flies autonomously and strikes your foes.

activities.desc:
You Release the weapon and it dances through the air, fighting on its own against the last enemy you attacked, or the nearest enemy to it if your target has been defeated. At the end of your turn each round, the weapon can Fly up to its fly Speed of 40 feet, and then can either Fly again or Strike one creature within its reach.

The weapon has a space of 5 feet, but it doesn't block or impede enemies attempting to move though that space, nor does it benefit from or provide flanking. The weapon can't move through an enemy's space. The weapon can't use reactions, and its Fly actions don't trigger reactions.

While it's activated, a dancing weapon makes Strikes with an attack modifier of +24 plus its item bonus to attack rolls. It uses the weapon's normal damage but has a +0 Strength modifier. The weapon's abilities that automatically trigger on a hit or critical hit still function, but the weapon can't be activated or benefit from any of your abilities while dancing.

Each round, when the weapon is finished using its actions, attempt a DC 6 flat check. On a failure, the activation ends and the weapon falls to the ground. You can't activate the item again for 10 minutes.
activities.name: Dancing Rune

name: Spell-Storing
desc: A spell-storing rune creates a reservoir of eldritch energy within the etched weapon. A spellcaster can spend 1 minute to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower into the weapon. The spell must have a casting of 2 actions or fewer and must be able to target a creature other than the caster. The spell has no immediate effect - it is instead stored for later. When you wield a spell-storing weapon, you immediately know the name and level of the stored spell. A spell-storing weapon found as treasure has a 50% chance of having a spell of the GM's choice stored in it.

activities.desc: You unleash the stored spell, which uses the target of the triggering attack as the target of the spell. This empties the spell from the weapon and allows a spell to be cast into it again. If the spell requires a spell attack roll, the result of your attack roll with the weapon determines the degree of success of the spell, and if the spell requires a saving throw, the DC is 30.
activities.name: Spell-Storing Rune
activities.requirements: On your previous action this turn, you hit and damaged a creature with this weapon

activities.desc: Harmlessly expend the stored spell. This frees the weapon to have a new spell cast into it.
activities.name: Clear Spell-Storing Rune

name: Keen
desc: The edges of a keen weapon are preternaturally sharp. Attacks with this weapon are a critical hit on a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success. This property has no effect on a 19 if the result would be a failure.
criticalHint: Attacks with this weapon are a critical hit on a 19 on the die as long as that result is a success.
usage: etched onto a piercing or slashing melee weapon

name: Speed
desc: Attacks with a speed weapon are supernaturally swift. While wielding a speed weapon, you gain the quickened condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the etched weapon.

hints.desc: While wielding a speed weapon, you gain the quickened condition, but you can use the additional action granted only to make a Strike with the etched weapon.

name: Vorpal
desc: Originally created as a means of slaying the legendary jabberwock, vorpal weapons prove equally effective against nearly any foe with a head.
usage: etched onto a slashing melee weapon

activities.desc: The target must succeed at a DC 37 Fortitude save or be decapitated. This kills any creature except ones that don't require a head to live. For creatures with multiple heads, this usually kills the creature only if you sever its last head.
activities.name: Vorpal Rune
activities.requirements: The target must have a head
activities.trigger: You roll a natural 20 on a Strike with the weapon, critically succeed, and deal slashing damage.
